## ⚙️ Pull Request Template

### 1. PR Scope

* **Type of Change:**
    * [ ] `feat:` (New feature)
    * [ ] `fix:` (Bug fix)
    * [ ] `refactor:` (Code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature)
    * [ ] `chore:` (Routine tasks, build system, dependency updates)
    * [ ] `docs:` (Documentation changes only)
    * [ ] `style:` (Code style/formatting changes)
* **Target Branch:** `staging` (All development PRs must target staging)

### 2. Required Checklist (Pre-Submission)

* [ ]  My branch is up-to-date with the latest `staging` branch (I have synced to minimize conflicts).
* [ ]  I have tested my changes locally, and they function as intended (no regressions).
* [ ]  The application builds locally without errors or broken dependencies.
* [ ]  The PR is focused on a **single issue/feature** (no mixed changes).
* [ ]  The PR size is **< 1000 lines** of modified code (additions + deletions).

### 3. PR Description (Mandatory Details)

| Section | Content |
| :--- | :--- |
| **Ticket Reference** | [CLICKUP] Link to the associated task/issue ticket. |
| **What does this PR do?** | (A clear, concise summary of the core feature or fix implemented.) |
| **How does it work?** | (Briefly explain the major technical changes, architectural patterns, or new dependencies introduced.) |
| **How does it affect current changes?** | (Describe any impacts on existing features, required configuration changes, or dependencies this PR introduces.) |

### 4. Visuals (Mandatory for UI/UX Changes)

* [ ]  This PR includes UI/user-facing changes.
    * **Screenshots/GIFs attached below:** (Paste images/links here demonstrating the new functionality or the fix.)
* [ ]  This PR is purely backend/non-UI related.

### 5. Reviewer Request

* **Mandatory Reviewer:** @[Reviewer's GitHub Handle]
